title: Mechanical Systems
body: User note:About this chapter: Mechanical systems are a key element of any building. Chapter 28 regulates such systems by linking to the International Mechanical CodeÂ® and Plumbing Code as adopted by 8 AAC 63.010, as amended from time to time, where details of mechanical system requirements are provided.

title: Scope
body: The provisions of this chapter, the International Mechanical Code and the Plumbing Code as adopted by 8 AAC 63.010, as amended from time to time shall govern the design, construction, erection and installation of mechanical appliances, equipment and systems used in buildings and structures covered by this code. Masonry chimneys, fireplaces and barbecues shall comply with the International Mechanical Code and Chapter 21 of this code. The International Fire Code, the International Property Maintenance Code, the International Mechanical Code and the Plumbing Code as adopted by 8 AAC 63.010, as amended from time to time shall govern the use and maintenance of mechanical components, appliances, equipment and systems. The International Existing Building Code, the International Mechanical Code and the Plumbing Code as adopted by 8 AAC 63.010, as amended from time to time shall govern the alteration, repair, relocation, replacement and addition of mechanical components, appliances, equipment and systems.
